title: Arrival of Estevao: New Messi For Barcelona?
Instruction: Hey, I've recorded the blog for you, just click on the video link to listen to it
italic: If the Blaugranes don't respond with a clear interest
content: Estêvão Willian Almeida de Oliveira Gonçalves, known as Messinho or Estevão, is a Brazilian footballer who plays as a winger for Serie A club Palmeiras.

was raised in Franca, Brazil, and started his youth career in 2017 at the Cruzeiro Academy. The fact that Estevao was signed by two of the biggest clubs in Brazil when he was just 14 speaks volumes. Ten years later, in Belo Horizonte, he started school at Cruzeiro. It was there that he became known as 'Messinho,' or 'Little Messi.' Because of the similarities in their playing styles, he first adopted the nickname as a tribute to Lionel Messi.

, surpassing both Neymar and Rodrygo to become the youngest Brazilian player to sign with apparel company Nike. Although he is still only 16 years old, he has already extended his contract until 2026.

, Barcelona made a move to pursue 'Brazilian Messi'! Chelsea, Manchester United, and Arsenal have expressed interest in signing Estevao 'Messinho' Willian, but the La Liga giant is set to sign the £60 million player.

, considering that Paris Saint-Germain, Chelsea, Arsenal, and Manchester City are also competitors. Unlike Barça, these clubs are not limited by financial difficulties. Until Messinho and Palmeiras find common ground, they will be in an untenable position.
, the Brazilian winger will have to take deals that are already being considered.

title: What makes 'Zodiac Killer' the most famous unsolved murder case in American history?
Instruction: Hey, I've recorded the blog for you, just click on the video link to listen to it
content: Because of the mystery that covers his crimes to this day, the Zodiac killer is among the most notorious serial killers in American history. Jake Gyllenhaal plays Greysmith, becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.

begins with two Lompoc High School seniors, fiancées Robert Domingos and Linda Edwards. While sunbathing on a beach near Gaviota State Park during their 'Senior Ditch Day' in June 1963, the two were bound with rope and were shot eleven and nine times respectively. Their bodies were dragged to a nearby shack where Robert's father found them soon after. Similarly, in October 1966, Cheri Bates left her father a note to say she'd gone to the Riverside City College Library only for her Volkswagen Beetle to be found abandoned there the next day, and her stabbed corpse left between two nearby houses. The local paper received a typed confession from the supposed killer one month later, and the following year, the newspaper, police, and Bates' father all received similar handwritten letters signed 'Z'. These events wouldn't be linked to the Zodiac killer until years later.

's story continued with Betty Lou Jensen and David Faraday in December 1968. While parked at a lovers' lane in Benicia, they were shot. Jensen was found shot in the back inside the car, and Faraday was shot in the head outside the vehicle. In Vallejo the next year, Darlene Ferrin and Michael Mageau were attacked while parked in another lovers' lane. A stranger shot them both. Ferrin died, but Mageau survived.

, college students Bryan Hartnell and Cecelia Shepard were both stabbed by a man wearing a hooded costume and the Zodiac symbol. Shepard died of her wounds, but Hartnell survived. One month later, 28-year-old cab driver Paul Stine was shot in the head and had a piece of his shirt removed. SFPD's Dave Toschi investigated the scene and would soon become the inspector most famously related to the case.

of the attention generated by Avery's articles, the Zodiac Killer demanded in April 1970 that people in the Bay Area wear 'Zodiac buttons' featuring his symbol. He expressed frustration in July 1970 about the lack of people wearing these buttons. The Zodiac had claimed an unidentified fourteenth victim, or it might have been Avery himself, according to a Halloween card Avery received a year after receiving Paul Stine's bloody clothes in the mail.

identified Allen from a mugshot in 1991, but the Vallejo police department deemed this invalid since, by his own admission, Mageau never got a good look at the gunman at the time. After Mageau's allegedly true statement, Robert Greysmith would go on to write the book that served as the basis for Fincher's film. Both works attempt to offer some closure by speculating that Allen was the Zodiac but that he passed away before the police could question him further.

title: People think Dune: Part Two is the most Stylish Cast of the Year
Instruction: Hey, I've recorded the blog for you, just click on the video link to listen to it
italic: See more of the best press tour
content: Why wouldn't they? It evident that we're excited for Dune: Part Two?

-directed film won't be released until March, there are already a ton of fashion-forward events and screenings planned in advance of its debut. During the cast's most recent red carpet visit in Mexico City last night, Zendaya and Florence Pugh both chose to wear simple, minimalist ensembles with striking textures. Alongside them, Timothée Chalamet held his own admirably in immaculate Prada tailoring.

in the styling that gave Chalamet's Prada appearance a slightly more modern and avant-garde feel than the conventional suit. The actor wore dress pants with a big Prada logo buckle on it, and tucked his button-up gray jacket into them. In addition, he eschewed a traditional dress shirt in favor of a contemporary collarless look and unbuttoned his jacket to show off the top underneath. Another talking point were his shoes, which were heeled boots, a favorite of Chalamet and a classy substitute for a traditional oxford.

the Dune: Part Two cast has been accumulating throughout the press tour are continued in this most recent Prada moment. Zendaya made a bold red carpet debut in Mexico City earlier this week for a young London-based designer; Florence Pugh dazzled in a futuristic Torishéju dress at the same event. Butler and Chalamet, on the other hand, have been donning chic, modern ensembles. Chalamet wore a gray collarless suit this week, and Butler wore a leather cowl-neck top from Hermès. Although there is a lot of action in the movie, we think the steps and repeats are even more exciting. We respond with, 'Keep 'em coming.'

, Chalamet looked as dapper as ever in this custom Givenchy couture suit that he paired with a graphic turtleneck and Cartier jewelry. Timothee Chalamet attends the 'Dune 2' Photocall at Shangri La Hotel on February 12, 2024 in Paris. Zendaya isn’t the only Dune star slipping into Bottega Veneta for the film’s press run—Chalamet went with a look from the Italian brand’s spring 2023 collection to attend a photocall in Paris.
looks from Dune: Part Two below.

title: Dune: Part Two’s New Cast Florence Pugh keep on getting big-budget roles
Instruction: Hey, I've recorded the blog for you, just click on the video link to listen to it
italic: These are her five greatest roles to date,
content: It’s her period. She was nominated for a BAFTA Award and an Academy Award for the final one. In the Cannes Film Festival of 2019, Pugh received the Trophée Chopard.

2019 saw Pugh achieve widespread recognition for her performances as professional wrestler Paige in the biographical sports film Fighting with My Family, a dejected American woman in the horror movie Midsommar, and Amy March in the historical drama Little Women.

Jean Tatlock is Florence Pugh's Oppenheimer character. Tatlock is a psychiatrist and member of the US Communist Party. He is romantically involved with J. Robert Oppenheimer. Oppenheimer was greatly affected by her suicide, which only made his tension and anxiety levels rise. Following her triumphs in Midsommar, Little Women, and The Wonder, she swiftly rose to prominence as a leading Hollywood actor. Pugh plays Prince Irulan in the eagerly awaited blockbuster Dune: Part Two in 2024.

The Wonder, directed by Sebastian Lelio and based on Emma Donoghue's novel, is set in the aftermath of the Great Famine of 1845–1852, which claimed the lives of about a million Irish people due to starvation brought on by failed crops. Pugh portrays Lib Wright, a former Crimean War nurse assigned to an isolated Irish farm to watch a young child who appears to have been fasting for four months. We gave it 4.5 stars because we found it to be haunting, mystical, and nuanced.

Florence Pugh had a significant year in 2019. After starring in the biographical wrestling drama Fighting With My Family, she was first seen by a wider audience in Ari Aster's A24 production Midsommar, which was the most successful of the three movies she starred in that year.Midsommar, which stars Pugh as Christian's traumatized and long-suffering girlfriend Dani, is at once luxurious, cathartic, and incredibly harrowing. After her sister, mother, and father pass away, the couple decides to visit their Swedish friend's hometown, where the yearly midsummer celebration—an increasingly gory event—is in full swing.
showcasing her in significant roles from this era

title: Google’s Gemini AI’s biggest upgrade is on the way
Instruction: Hey, we upload amazing content on youtube too, check out!
content: Just two months after launching Gemini, Google's big language model for AI, they're rolling out Gemini 1.5. It's already available for developers and businesses, with a wider release for regular users coming soon.
is really pushing Gemini as a tool for business, personal assistance, and more.

matches the high-end Gemini Ultra's performance and beats the previous Gemini 1.0 Pro in 87% of tests. They use a technique called 'Combination of Experts' to make it faster for users and more efficient for Google.

including CEO Sundar Pichai, excited is the massive context window in Gemini 1.5. It can handle much bigger queries and process a lot more information at once. The context window is now 1 million tokens, compared to 128,000 for OpenAI's GPT-4 and 32,000 for the old Gemini Pro.

you can ask the AI about a ton of content all at the same time, like 10 or 11 hours of video or thousands of lines of code. Pichai even mentioned they're testing a 10 million token context window – that's like throwing the whole Game of Thrones series at it in one shot.

title: Follow these five basic but essential steps to have amazing skin
Instruction: Hey, we upload amazing content on youtube too, check out!
italic: ‘But there's a hope that's waiting for you in the dark. You should know you're beautiful just the way you are. And you don't have to change a thing. The world could change its heart. No scars to your beautiful We're stars and we're beautiful’
underline: Step 1: Wash your face with a gentle cleanser:
content: Sure, if you've never taken any kind of skin care regimen before. Your complexion will seem more hydrated. This can show up as glowiness, smoothness, plumpness, etc.
understand the fact that “Less is more”. Do not use any excessive amount of product at a time on your skin. Take as much as your skin needs just to cover the whole face.

I suggest ‘Simple Refreshing Facewash’. Every morning when you wake up and every evening right before bed. All day long, pollutants and debris are exposed to your skin, and if you wear makeup, this gunk builds up on your face. You can rid your face of undesired build-up, debris, and dangerous bacteria before you turn in by washing it all off.

Although cleansing eliminates impurities, it may also deplete your skin's natural moisture content. Use a moisturizer that will maintain the equilibrium, health, and hydration of your skin. I suggest ‘CeraVe’.

Like Benzoyl peroxide or Retinol or Adapalene, you can start with one of them. You suggest you use Benzoyl peroxide for about 6 months every night and then add Adapalene with the routine. Use 3 days each in a week. Don’t forget to use moisturizer over it.
No matter the season or climate, you should be protecting your skin with SPF every day. Especially when you are using an anti-inflammatory, do not go out without using sunscreen.

If you are left with acne prone skin, I suggest you avoid makeup as much as possible. Only use Sunscreen or Moisturizer while going out. For an everyday basis Sunscreen should be enough to give you that “high school girl glow”.
Don’t stress yourself too much. Trust your routine. If it works for you, don't try to change it. Stick with routine for a long time.
- ‘Alessia Cara’

title: Alaska is Not the Best Place to See Aurora; Canada Is
Instruction: Hey, we upload amazing content on youtube too, check out!
italic: The ability to combine a visit with wildlife
content: An aurora is a naturally occurring light show in the sky that is mostly visible in high-latitude regions, such as those surrounding the Arctic and Antarctic. It is also referred to as the southern lights or the northern lights.

causes disruptions in the magnetosphere, which lead to auroras. Dynamic patterns of brilliant lights, resembling curtains, rays, spirals, or dynamic flickers, cover the entire sky during an aurora display.

of stunning, pristine wilderness in Newfoundland and Labrador, particularly in the pristine region of Labrador. Snowmobile on almost 1,500 kilometers of trails in the wintertime while admiring the dancing Northern Lights. If you'd like, add ice fishing, hunting, cross-country skiing, and snowshoeing.

to the glittering Lights reflecting off glassy lakes fed by glaciers and set against the majestic backdrop of the Canadian Rockies. The Geophysical Observatory at Athabasca University, which investigates the Aurora's magnetic influence on Earth, is based in northern Alberta, which is not surprising. For the best viewpoints, non-scientists should go to Banff National Park.
the effect is more likely to be seen in the north and in the Arctic, but lower latitudes in Canada—including Ontario—still offer regular opportunities to see the elusive aurora.

Hudson Bay, Northern Manitoba is situated in the sub-Arctic Circle. Churchill, which describes itself as 'one of the top three places on the planet' to see the Lights, is located up here. In fact, to study the aurora, scientists travel from all over the world to this nearly 900-person town known for its polar bear population.

viewing—think belugas, polar bears, Arctic foxes, and more—makes a trip even more memorable. The best way is via Winnipeg, with a stop at the Manitoba Museum to learn more about the Lights and get advice on taking the best photos of them.
